articles.title: DPRK Premier Reviews Work in Musan Mining Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Reviews Work in Musan Mining Complex
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim made field survey of production in the Musan Mining Complex on Nov. 13 and 14.
					
					 After touring a Large Cone-shaped Crusher Site No. 2 and an open-air branch mine and other places of the complex, he convened a consultative meeting of officials concerned.
					
					 Discussed at the meeting were measures for improving the earth- scraping, disposal of lean ore and transport of concentrated ore in line with the expanded iron ore production capacity.
					
					 The premier also acquainted himself with the Tanchon Port construction. He took field measures to settle issues arising in ensuring the depth of water at the port with all efforts concentrated on dredging and conducting the ground construction project as required by the construction method following the completion of major construction including breakwater.

articles.title: Kim Yong Chun Meets CPLA Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Chun Meets CPLA Delegation 

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Wednesday met and had a friendly talk with the high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army which paid a courtesy call on him. The delegation is led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA.

articles.title: CPLA Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
CPLA Delegation Pays Homage to Kim Il Sung

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army Wednesday visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung. It was led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA.
					
					 Present were Kim Jong Gak, member of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and first vice director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 A floral basket was placed before the statue of the President in the name of the delegation.
					
					 Visitors bowed in humble reverence to the President who made an immortal contribution to strengthening the DPRK-China friendship.
					
					 The head of the delegation wrote in the visitor's book that the President will always live in the hearts of the people.

articles.title: CPLA Delegation Visits Martyrs Cemetery and Friendship Tower
articles.content:
CPLA Delegation Visits Martyrs Cemetery and Friendship Tower

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the CPLA General Political Department, Wednesday laid wreaths before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Friendship Tower.
					
					 Present there were General of the Korean People's Army Pak Jae Gyong and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, at the cemetery and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
					
					 Wreaths were placed before the cemetery and tower in the name of the delegation.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the revolutionary martyrs and the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers.
					
					 The head of the delegation made entries in the visitor's books.

articles.title: CPLA Delegation Enjoys Performance
articles.content:
CPLA Delegation Enjoys Performance

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army enjoyed a performance given by Pyongyang artistes on Wednesday. The delegation is led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the General Political Department of the CPLA.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Chun, vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and minister of the People's Armed Forces, Gen. Pak Jae Gyong, and other generals and officers of the KPA, Chinese Ambassador Liu Hongcai, Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng and staff members of the Chinese embassy here and Chinese guests staying in the DPRK.
					
					 Put on the stage were chorus "March of Korean Youth", mixed duet and chorus "Here Is the Country Where I Live", female sixtet and chorus "Let Us Keep Pace with Army Song", national dance "Fan Dance" and tap dance "At the Well".
					
					 The performers impressively showed the revolutionary spirit and staunch fighting trait of the army and people of the DPRK dynamically advancing toward the bright future with the confidence under the leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Also put on the stage were the theme song of TV series "Mao Anying" and other Chinese songs.
					
					 A floral basket was conveyed to the performers in congratulations of their successful performance.

articles.title: DPRK FM Meets Austrian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK FM Meets Austrian Ambassador

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Martin Sajdik, outgoing Austrian ambassador to the DPRK, on Wednesday.

articles.title: DPRK Friendship Order Conferred on Austrian
articles.content:
DPRK Friendship Order Conferred on Austrian

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Order of DPRK Friendship 2nd Class was conferred on Peter Noever, ex-director of MAK Vienna, Austria.
					
					 He made great contributions to the development of the friendly relations and cultural exchange between the DPRK and Austria by initiating an art exhibition "Flower to President Kim Il Sung, Art and Architecture of the DPRK" in Austria and making efforts for the successful exhibition.
					
					 The conferring ceremony took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Han Chol, vice-minister of Culture, officials concerned and Martin Sajdik, Austrian ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: Indian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Indian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Ambassador Pratap Singh and staff members of the Indian embassy here did friendship work at the DPRK-India Friendship Kalchon Co-op Farm in Nampho on Wednesday.
					
					 The guests helped the farmers in threshing.
					
					 They enjoyed an art performance given by children and exchanged talks with the farm's officials.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Birthday Spreads Given to Scientist and Educator
articles.content:
Birthday Spreads Given to Scientist and Educator
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent birthday spreads to Candidate Academician, Pro. and Dr. Jong Yon U who is Merited Scientist and a researcher of the Neuropsychiatry Research Institute under the Academy of Medical Sciences, and People's Teacher Kang Jun Ho who is principal of Changdok School on occasions of their 80th and 70th birthdays.
					
					 Jong worked hard for the development of the medical science of the country and the promotion of health of the people over the past 50 years.
					
					 He wrote many textbooks and reference books, achieved valuable successes in researches and brought up dozens of persons with academic degrees or titles.
					
					 Working as the principal of Changdok School for 25 years Kang spruced up the school associated with the revolutionary history of President Kim Il Sung and contributed to bringing about a turn in education of prodigies.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il invited them to participate in major national meetings and made sure that they were accorded high official commendations.

articles.title: Winter Study Tour of Revolutionary Sites Starts
articles.content:
Winter Study Tour of Revolutionary Sites Starts

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Servicepersons, working people and school youth and children from across the DPRK started the winter study tour of battle sites and revolutionary sites in Ryanggang Province.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung in the Battle Site in Pochonbo, on the shore of Lake Samji, in the Monument to Victory in Battles in Musan Area and the Chongbong Bivouac Ground and a mosaic depicting the three commanders of Mt. Paektu erected in the Secret Camp on Mt. Paektu.
					
					 Touring the commanding post of Pochonbo battle, police post of the Japanese imperialists, sub-county office, slogan-bearing trees, etc. they deeply grasped the rare military tactics and outstanding commanding art of the President.
					
					 They visited the area of Samjiyon township that turned into a socialist land of bliss.
					
					 Then they mounted Mt. Paektu, holy mountain of the revolution. At leader Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan secret camp they looked round with keen interest the relics preserved with care.
					
					 They laid flowers before the statue of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, in the revolutionary site in Sinpha and made a bow to her.
					
					 They also visited the Phophyong Revolutionary Site associated with revolutionary history of the President and members of Mangyongdae family.
					
					 Marching along the path associated with the footprints of the anti-Japanese revolutionary forerunners, they held an oath-taking meeting, meeting to hear impressions of the reminiscences of anti-Japanese guerrillas read by them, a contest of singing revolutionary songs in chorus while marching in array and other colorful political and cultural events.

articles.title: Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Memorial Palace
articles.content:
Trees Planted in Arboretum of Kumsusan Memorial Palace
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) from across the country planted trees in the arboretum of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Wednesday.
					
					 Those of the Central Committee of the UAWK and at least 20 city (district) and county committees of the UAWK in Pyongyang, South and North Phyongan Provinces and North Hwanghae Province prepared over 9,000 trees of 11 species and over 12,500 flower roots of 6 species.
					
					 They also handed over at least 17,500 pieces of materials of 4 kinds useful for further sprucing up the sacred temple of Juche in a sublime way

articles.title: Matches of Top Soccer Teams Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Matches of Top Soccer Teams Held in Pyongyang 

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- League matches of top soccer teams took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang recently. 
					
					 They drew four men's teams and four women's teams which proved successful in the latest round of the premier league held some time ago. 
					
					 Following are the standings of men's teams:  
					
					No./ Team / Matches Played / Won / Drawn / Lost / Goals for, Goals against Point
					
					1. April 25 / 3 / 2/ 1 / 0 / 4-1 7
					
					2. Sobaeksu / 3 / 1 / 1 / 1 / 3-3 4
					
					3. Amnokgang / 3 / 0 / 2 / 1 / 1-2 2
					
					4. Kigwancha / 3 / 0 / 2 / 1 / 0-2 2
					
					Following are the standings of women's teams: 
					
					No. / Team / Matches Played / Won / Drawn / Lost / Goals for, Goals against Point
					
					1. April 25 / 3 / 3 / 0 / 0 / 7-1 9
					
					2. Amnokgang / 3 / 2 / 0 / 1 / 6-4 6
					
					3. Sobaeksu / 3 / 1 / 0 / 2 / 3-5 3
					
					4. Rimyongsu / 3 / 0 / 0 / 3 / 1-7 0

articles.title: I Will Miss Mt. Kumgang: Tourist
articles.content:
I Will Miss Mt. Kumgang: Tourist
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- "It is very significant for me to visit Mt. Kumgang," a Chinese tourist said after enjoying sightseeing in the famous mountain. 
					
					 Zhang Sin, a businesswoman belonging to a tourist group from Harbin, China, told KCNA: 
					
					 When I reached Kuryong Waterfall, I felt refreshed. Listening to interesting legends about the mountain, I felt never tired in climbing.
					
					 I admired Sea Kumgang for its seascape and beautiful ravines.
					
					 A legend says a king dropped in at Lagoon Samil but stayed for three days, fascinated by its scenery, so the lagoon was named after samil (three days). But I wanted to stay there for more than ten days.
					
					 It would be better to call it Lagoon Yolhul (ten days). I will miss Mt. Kumgang.
					
					 I want to come to Korea again with my friends and family members to tour famous mountains like Kumgang, Myohyang, Kuwol and Chilbo.

articles.title: Japan's False Document for Invading Korea
articles.content:
Japan's False Document for Invading Korea

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Japanese imperialists fabricated the "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" by dint of armed forces on November 17, 1905 to convert Korea into their colony.
					
					 After pushing Czarist Russia out of Korea through the Russo-Japanese war, they lost no time in setting about putting Korea under its domination.
					
					 For this purpose, they sent Hirobumi Ito, the flag-bearer in invading Korea, to Seoul.
					
					 Ito met with Emperor Kojong and conveyed a draft "treaty", urging him to accept it.
					
					 With Kojong categorically refusing to accept it, Ito lured ministers of the Ri feudal government into the Japanese legation and threatened, blackmailed and appeased them for the criminal purpose of Japan, but to no effect.
					
					 The Japanese imperialists redeployed their main forces in Korea from the Russo-Japanese war, encircling the royal palace and cracking down on the Korean people's anti-Japanese sentiments throughout the country. 
					
					 A meeting was held at the royal palace over the conclusion of the "treaty" but was broken off for ministers' opposition.
					
					 Incensed by this, the Japanese imperialists convened a cabinet meeting and stamped the "treaty" themselves with the seal of the Foreign Ministry of the Ri government.
					
					 The "treaty" was designed to deprive the Ri government of the diplomatic right and set up Japan's residency-general to take the reins of Korea.
					
					 The "Ulsa Five-point Treaty" was a false document for aggression fabricated in a gangster-like way without even the king's signature and the official sealing of the state.

articles.title: Mural Tomb Dating Back to Koguryo Period
articles.content:
Mural Tomb Dating Back to Koguryo Period

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A mural tomb, believed to be built in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (277 B.C.- 668 A.D.), is located in Susan-ri, Kangso District, Nampho City in Korea.
					
					 The tomb consists of a corridor and chamber.
					
					 The corridor, 4.5 meters long, 1.6 meters wide and 1.8 meters high, is roofed with a large plate stone. The square chamber is 4.1 meters high.
					
					 The tomb's walls are decorated with paintings. 
					
					 Noticeable in the decorations is a painting on the west wall portraying acrobatic feats. The painting is indicative of the development of acrobatics in the kingdom and its people's optimistic life.  
					
					 The colors of the beautiful paintings remain vivid.
					
					 The tomb, one of the historical relics representing the Eastern culture at that time, reflects the advanced culture of the Korean people in the middle ages.

articles.title: Yonphung Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Yonphung Revolutionary Site
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Yonphung Revolutionary Site is located in Kanggye City, Jagang Province.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung stayed in the site in December Juche 39 (1950) to preside over the 30th Plenum of the Cabinet and make preparations of the 3rd Plenum of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea in order to encourage the whole party and all the people to win the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War (June 25, 1950-July 27, 1953).
					
					 During his stay there, he paved a way for the victory in the war and mapped out a plan for post-war rehabilitation and construction.
					
					 The historical relics and materials preserved there showcase the superb leadership, unshakable will and popular traits of the President, who defeated the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces and defended the destiny of the nation.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, who visited the site in September Juche 88 (1999), said the great feats the President performed for the freedom and independence of the fatherland and the happiness of the people would always be kept in the memory of the Korean people.
					
					 The site includes a two-storied museum where the President officiated the 30th Cabinet Plenum, a house where he had a consultative meeting with officials and a spring.

articles.title: U.S. Attempt to Mount Preemptive Nuclear Attack on DPRK Slammed
articles.content:
U.S. Attempt to Mount Preemptive Nuclear Attack on DPRK Slammed

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- It is the U.S. military strategy toward the DPRK to stifle it through preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a by-lined commentary, disclosing the U.S. attempt at the nuclear attack.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The U.S. worked out a document with the south Korean puppet forces, which stipulates the use of nuclear weapons against the DPRK in case of "contingency" after listing the DPRK as the target of its preemptive nuclear attack.
					
					 Joint military exercises are frequent in south Korea every year, pursuant to the nuclear war scenario. 
					
					 The U.S. staged joint military exercises with Japan around the Korean Peninsula by mobilizing huge forces under the pretense of coping with the "nuclear threat" from someone. Clear is their target.
					
					 The development shows that the U.S. ambition for nuclear attack has entered a reckless phase.
					
					 Its attempt to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on the DPRK is an anachronistic daydream. 
					
					 It had better give up its design. This is the way for it to get rid of destruction.
					
					 Minju Joson in a by-lined commentary says that the U.S. and south Korean warmongers worked out a "strategy for extended nuclear deterrence" which allows the use of ultra-modern war hardware including nuclear umbrella and MD system, a strategy to provoke a nuclear war against the DPRK under the signboard of "deterrent."

articles.title: Unity of Democratic Forces for Reform of S. Korea Is Key to Victory
articles.content:
Unity of Democratic Forces for Reform of S. Korea Is Key to Victory

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Only when the democratic forces for reform in south Korea wage a struggle in close unity, can they overcome the desperate challenges of the conservative forces and achieve the final victory.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 New politics and life are the demand of the popular masses who aspire after new things against the old conservative rule. The struggle of the south Korean people, therefore, is sure to triumph, it noted.
					
					 The present "government" in south Korea has pursued the policy of depending on foreign forces and the fascist dictatorial rule. As a result, the dignity and sovereignty of the people have been mercilessly violated and democracy and human rights been abused in the south Korean society, it said.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 The south Korean ruling forces took power by deceiving the people with such false commitment as "economic recovery". They, however, failed to guarantee the majority of the popular masses the rights but forced them into poverty while defending the interests of a few privileged classes.
					
					 It admits of no argument what will be the result of the maneuvers of the ruling forces who keep to the reactionary conservatism while quenching the people's desire for new politics and life. 
					
					 No one can help those old conservative forces from being ousted from the stage of history by the united struggle of the people aspiring after independence.
					
					 The results of the recent election for Seoul mayor showed that the broad democratic forces for reform in south Korea can surely win victory if they wage a struggle in unity no matter how desperately the conservative group may resort to tricky and high-handed practices and fascist oppression.

articles.title: S. Korean Rev. Calls for Stop to Jeju Naval Base Construction
articles.content:
S. Korean Rev. Calls for Stop to Jeju Naval Base Construction

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A high-ranking military delegation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army led by Li Jinai, member of the Central Military Commission of the Communist Party of China and director of the CPLA General Political Department, Wednesday laid wreaths before the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong and the Friendship Tower.
					
					 Present there were General of the Korean People's Army Pak Jae Gyong and Ambassador Liu Hongcai and Military, Naval and Air Attache Sun Yanfeng of the Chinese embassy here.
					
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, at the cemetery and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
					
					 Wreaths were placed before the cemetery and tower in the name of the delegation.
					
					 They paid silent tribute to the revolutionary martyrs and the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers.
					
					 The head of the delegation made entries in the visitor's books.

articles.title: S. Korean Prosecution's Suppression of Pro-reunification Figures under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Prosecution's Suppression of Pro-reunification Figures under Fire
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Those concerned of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon) condemned the prosecution for its anti-reunification measures.
					
					 At the Seoul Central District Court on November 9 the authorities held a final trial of former and incumbent members of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon who were indicted on the charge of the violation of the "National Security Law".
					
					 The prosecution demanded seven years of prison terms for Ri Kyu Jae, chairman of the South Headquarters of Pomminryon, eight years for Ri Kyong Won, its former secretary general, and six years for Choe Un A, its former agitation chairperson. Five years' suspension of qualifications was imposed on all of them.
					
					 The prosecution charged that they conducted activities benefiting the enemy while having contact with the north and that they have committed a heavy sin of having been involved in Pomminryon activities after their release.
					
					 Ri Kyu Jae in his final statement said the way the U.S. and dictatorial regime suppress pro-reunification figures by invoking the NSL is just the same as the one used by the Japanese imperialists who suppressed fighters for national independence by dint of the "law on maintenance of public order" in the past.
					
					 Ri Kyong Won said that all the activities he has conducted so far are patriotic ones to be least shamed of and his children would achieve reunification without fail following in his footstep.
					
					 Choe Un A said her faith would remain unchanged whatever suppression she may face.

articles.title: FTA Blamed by S. Korean Organizations
articles.content:
FTA Blamed by S. Korean Organizations

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea issued Monday a commentary blaming the group of pro-U.S. flunkeys and traitors for working hard for the conclusion of the humiliating "Free Trade Agreement".
					
					 To enforce the "motion calling for ratification of Free Trade Agreement" which totally reflects the U.S. demand, the present "government" and "Grand National Party" are suppressing the opposition forces by using such suppression gears as water cannon and employing every possible means, the commentary said.
					
					 The "government" and the GNP are no better than the "five traitors of 1905" as they seek to pass the traitorous agreement through the "National Assembly", while going against the public sentiment, it added.
					
					 It warned the authorities will be severely punished if they keep going against the people to serve the interests of the U.S. and a handful of big businesses.

articles.title: Korean Women in U.S. Oppose FTA
articles.content:
Korean Women in U.S. Oppose FTA

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Korean women in the U.S. released a declaration on November 12 opposing the conclusion of the humiliating U.S.-south Korea "Free Trade Agreement".
					
					 The declaration said the south Korean authorities push forward the conclusion of the agreement under the pretext of advancing south Korea's economy.
					
					 The FTA is aimed to transplant American-style capitalism to the south Korean economy, said the declaration.
					
					 The agreement, reflecting the unilateral interests of the U.S., is as disgraceful as the "Ulsa Five-Point Treaty", it noted.
					
					 Experts in economy and law are voicing increasing concern over the danger of the agreement full of unequal items and damage it can cause, it added.
					
					 It called on the south Korean women to come out against the conclusion of the FTA.

articles.title: Namibian President Hopes Development of Friendly Ties with DPRK
articles.content:
Namibian President Hopes Development of Friendly Ties with DPRK
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- President of Namibia Hifikepunye Pohamba hoped for the development of good friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK in several fields.  He said this when receiving the credentials from DPRK Ambassador to Namibia Jo Yong Man on Nov. 9. 
					
					 The president said the bilateral relations were provided by President Kim Il Sung during the period of the struggle for independence of Namibia.
					
					 He expressed thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for paying deep attention to the development of the bilateral relations.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Answers to ITAR-TASS Supported in Russia and Syria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Answers to ITAR-TASS Supported in Russia and Syria

					Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Personages of Russia and Syria made public statements as regards the answers General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave to the questions by ITAR-TASS of Russia.
					
					 The general director of a Russia-DPRK joint venture company said in his statement on Nov. 10 as follows:
					
					 Kim Jong Il in his answers set forth guidelines for further developing ties with Russia and clarified the principled stand of the DPRK government on the nuclear issue of the Korean Peninsula and the DPRK's relations with the United States and Japan.
					
					 We warmly congratulate his visit to the Siberian and Far Eastern regions of the Russian Federation and fully support his answers to the ITAR-TASS's questions.
					
					 We sincerely hope that the Korean people would tide over trials and register greater success in their efforts to build a thriving nation.
					
					 Saber Ballul, head of Department of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus of Syria, said in his statement on Nov. 9 that Kim Jong Il in his answers stressed the need to boost the DPRK-Russia friendly and cooperative relations and expressed conviction that the Korean people's cause of building socialism would emerge victorious.
					
					 The world progressives are sure that the DPRK will successfully build a thriving nation without fail as long as it has the great party, powerful army and stalwart people wisely led by Kim Jong Il as well as the nuclear deterrent for self-defence, he added.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Implementing 12th Five-Year Plan Comprehensively
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Implementing 12th Five-Year Plan Comprehensively

					 Beijing, November 15 (KCNA) -- Chinese Vice-premier Li Keqiang called for carrying out the 12th Five-year plan in an all-round way.
					
					 Speaking at the Development Research Centre of the State Council, Li said the centre should intensify researches in important issues and policies to promote the comprehensive implementation of the plan.
					
					 By doing so, it should help ensure a long-term, stable and relatively rapid development of the economy, the vice-premier added.

articles.title: Chinese Official Calls for Raising IT Level of Economy, Society
articles.content:
Chinese Official Calls for Raising IT Level of Economy, Society

					 Beijing, November 15 (KCNA) -- Zhang Dejiang, vice-premier of the Chinese State Council, called for raising the IT level of the economy and society.
					
					 Addressing a recently held national forum of IT experts, Zhang said a priority should be paid to promoting the combination of IT basis and industrialization and developing core and vital technologies. 
					
					 It is also important to speed up building IT facilities suitable for the new era and ensure the safety of networks and information, the vice-premier added.

articles.title: China Opposes Double Standards in Protection of Civilians
articles.content:
China Opposes Double Standards in Protection of Civilians
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Chinese permanent representative to the United Nations called for protecting civilians from armed conflicts.      
					
					 Speaking at a recent meeting of the UN Security Council, the Chinese official said the protection of civilians should be consistent to the purport and principles of the UN charter.
					
					 In this regard it is important to respect the national sovereignty, unity, territorial integrity and principle of non-interference in other's internal affairs and quit methods of option and double standards, the representative added.

articles.title: China Completes Second Docking Test
articles.content:
China Completes Second Docking Test

					Beijing, November 15 (KCNA) -- China successfully completed Monday the country's second space docking that linked the unmanned spacecraft Shenzhou-8 again with the prototype space lab Tiangong-1, according to the mission's control center.
					
					 The Beijing Aerospace Control Center (BACC), which commanded the Shenzhou-8 mission, called the re-docking a success, during which functions of the measuring equipment and docking mechanism were tested in solar light.

articles.title: Development of Universities Urged in China
articles.content:
Development of Universities Urged in China

					 Beijing, November 15 (KCNA) -- He Guoqiang, secretary of the              Central Commission for Discipline Inspection of China, called for promoting the development of universities.  
					
					 Inspecting some universities in Beijing recently, he said that universities should be put on a higher level of development to train many able persons needed for the party and state affairs.     
					
					 Specially, it is important to help students from poor families continue studying at universities and university graduates get jobs, he added.

articles.title: Iranian Parliament Speaker Accuses IAEA
articles.content:
Iranian Parliament Speaker Accuses IAEA
						

					 Tehran, November 15 (KCNA) -- Iranian Parliament Speaker Ali Larijani on Nov. 13 accused the International Atomic Energy Agency of kowtowing to the U.S.
					
					 The IAEA's recent report was released at the instructions of the U.S. and Israel, he said, branding the report as another evidence proving hostility toward Iran.
					
					 The report proved that Iran's cooperation does not have any impact on IAEA's decisions on Iran, he noted, adding:  Iran will review cooperation with IAEA.

articles.title: Iranian Army Well-prepared to Counteract Any Threat: Commander
articles.content:
Iranian Army Well-prepared to Counteract Any Threat: Commander 
						

					 Tehran, November 15 (KCNA) -- The commander of the Iranian Army's Ground Forces said on Saturday Iran's armed forces are well-prepared to counteract any hostile action. 
					
					 He condemned the U.S., Israel and the western countries for their new threats against Iran. Iran's armed forces are sharply following the slightest movement of the enemies, fully ready to cope with it, he stressed.
					
					 He termed the new threats as a bluff to overshadow the internal contradictions and their immense domestic crisis.
					
					 They inevitably have no choice to mislead their and other nations' public opinion to something other than what they are suffering from, so they pose such a threat to Iran.

articles.title: Iran to Launch Three New Satellites in Near Future
articles.content:
Iran to Launch Three New Satellites in Near Future
						

					 Tehran, November 15 (KCNA) -- Iran plans to launch three new domestically-produced satellites into space in the near future.
					
					 It has plans to send a man into space by 2020, the government said on Nov. 13.

articles.title: Russian FM Slashes at U.S., West Sanctions against Iran
articles.content:
Russian FM Slashes at U.S., West Sanctions against Iran
						

					 Moscow, November 15 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov Monday rejected the U.S. and West sanctions against Iran.
					
					 The U.S., Israel and the Europe are making a fuss over the recent report of the International Atomic Energy Agency on Iran's nuclear program, which lacks new contents, he said, adding:
					
					 This campaign may be a fabrication or a means to build public opinion and lay a foundation for fresh unilateral sanctions.
					
					 The racket over Iran's nuclear program is fevered to impose unilateral sanctions, he noted, adding that threatening sanctions and air strike would make the negotiated settlement of the issue more complicated.

articles.title: Qatari PM: Arab Countries Reject Threat against Iran
articles.content:
Qatari PM: Arab Countries Reject Threat against Iran
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Hamad bin Jassem al-Thani in a press conference on Saturday rejected threat against Iran.
					
					 He said that Iran is our neighbor and we are opposed to any kind of threat against it, because such threats will affect the whole region.
					
					 He expressed hope that Iran's nuclear issue would be settled through peaceful means, far from the threat language.

articles.title: Turkey Opposes Military Threat against Iran
articles.content:
Turkey Opposes Military Threat against Iran
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Turkish Foreign Minister Ahmet Davutoglu on Nov. 12 clarified the stand of the government opposing the military threat against Iran.
					
					 The military threat of the U.S. and Israel against Iran will further aggravate the instability in the region, he said, adding: Turkey calls for settling all the issues through dialogue.

articles.title: Brazil Opposes Sanctions on Iran
articles.content:
Brazil Opposes Sanctions on Iran

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Brazilian Foreign Minister Antonio Patriota Friday clarified the stand of Brazil opposing the sanctions on Iran.
					
					 "Our goal is to promote confidence and reduce tensions, contribute to the solution of difficult and complex matters," the minister said, adding: Brazil considers diplomacy the best way to tackle this issue.
					
					 The minister called on the international community to settle Iran's nuclear issue through dialogue and diplomacy, not through new sanctions.

articles.title: Ecuadorian President Rejects U.S. Influence on Regional Organizations
articles.content:
Ecuadorian President Rejects U.S. Influence on Regional Organizations
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Ecuadorian President Rafael Correa recently clarified the stand rejecting the U.S. exercising influence on regional organizations.
					
					 The U.S. is committing high-handed and arbitrary practices in the Organization of American States, Correa noted.
					
					 The United States does not recognize the Inter-American Convention on Human Rights, Correa said.
					
					 Correa also condemned that a U.S. woman, Dinah Shelton, chairs the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (ICHR), and described as very dangerous having taken the country to that organization trying to make it look bad for defending private interests.
					
					 Correa called for revising such system.

articles.title: Kenya Condemns Unreasonable Step of Western Countries
articles.content:
Kenya Condemns Unreasonable Step of Western Countries
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The Kenyan government in a recent statement chided the western countries for their unreasonable travel restrictions on Kenya.
					
					 Western countries issued travel advisories, talking about instability in Kenya, the statement said, adding this hinders Kenya's economic development.
					
					 Kenya is safe, it noted, adding: The big economy countries should consider the millions of people who depend on tourism in terms of employment and livelihoods before making decisions that end up impacting negatively.

articles.title: Mozambique Injects Many Funds in Clean Water Project
articles.content:
Mozambique Injects Many Funds in Clean Water Project
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Mozambique is working hard to settle the issue of drinking water of inhabitants.
					
					 The government recently planned to supply clean drinking water to one million inhabitants.
					
					 According to the plan, projects for building new water supply facilities will be conducted in the central provinces of Sofala, Manica and Tete. The government decided to inject many funds in this work.

articles.title: Sri Lanka's President on Regional Development
articles.content:
Sri Lanka's President on Regional Development 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Sri Lanka's President Mahinda Rajapaksa mentioned about the region's development in his recent speech at the summit of the SAARC (South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation).
					
					 Noting that money can not be almighty in the region's development, he said the human being was a main source of development and trust in the human being is the most powerful force in the regional development.
					
					 He stressed the need for the regional countries to improve education and find a solution to the youth issue.

articles.title: SAARC to Promote Regional Cooperation: Nepali PM
articles.content:
SAARC to Promote Regional Cooperation: Nepali PM
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Nepali Prime Minister Baburam Bhattarai on Nov. 12 called for promoting regional cooperation.
					
					 He said that the 17th South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) Summit has been productive in terms of promoting regional cooperation. 
					
					 He stressed the need to effectively implement the South Asian Free Trade Agreement (SAFTA).
					
					 He expressed his hope that SAFTA would be useful in promoting investment and trade.

articles.title: SDF Starts Combined Military Exercises
articles.content:
SDF Starts Combined Military Exercises 
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Japan is getting hell-bent on military exercises to round off war preparations for reinvasion.
					
					 It started large-scale combined maneuvers in military bases across the country, its surrounding waters and in the air on Monday.
					
					 The maneuvers that will last till Friday involve drills under the simulated conditions of an actual war with an aim to increase coordination capability of ground, naval and air "Self-Defense Forces."

articles.title: Oil Output Increases in Kuwait
articles.content:
Oil Output Increases in Kuwait

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- Kuwait has increased its daily crude oil output to more than 3.5 million barrels per day (bpd), more 600,000 bpd than September. This was made by the government on Nov. 13.

articles.title: Gap between Rich and Poor Widens in U.S.
articles.content:
Gap between Rich and Poor Widens in U.S.
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- The severe gap between the rich and the poor is a source of louder discontent in the U.S.
					
					 According to a national survey of public opinion conducted jointly by the Washington Post and ABC, more than sixty percent of the respondents said that the gap between the rich and the poor was wider than before.

articles.title: Protest in U.S.
articles.content:
Protest in U.S.
						

					 Pyongyang, November 16 (KCNA) -- A protest was staged in Honolulu, Hawaii on Nov. 12.
					
					 Hundreds of demonstrators took to the streets of Honolulu and criticized moves toward trade liberalization as an attempt to benefit large corporations only

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim recorre Complejo de Minas de Musan
articles.content:
Banquete en honor de la delegacion militar de China

					Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La Direccion Politica General del Ejercito Popular de Corea ofrecio el dia 15 un banquete en honor de la delegacion militar de alto nivel del Ejercito Popular de Liberacion de China (EPLCh).
					
					Fueron invitados a la comida los integrantes de la delegacion militar de alto nivel de la EPLCh presidida por el director del Departamento Politico General, Li Jinai, el embajador Liu Hongcai y el agregado militar Sun Yanfeng, de la embajada china en Corea.
					
					Estuvieron presentes el primer subjefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Kim Jong Gak, el general de ejercito Pak Jae Gyong, el teniente general Kim Su Hak y otros generales y oficiales del EPC.
					
					Al pronunciar el discurso, Kim Jong Gak subrayo que la visita de la delegacion   militar  de alto nivel de China en el presente anos, en que se celebraron comun y significativamente el 50o aniversario de la concertacion del tratado sobre la amistad, la cooperacion y la ayuda mutua China-Corea, sirve de un importante motivo para poner en la etapa mas elevada la amistad entre los ejercitos de dos paises.
					
					Agrego que la amistad entre los dos paises preparadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung con los revolucionarios veteranos de China acoge ahora la nueva era dorada bajo la profunda atencion de los maximos Dirigentes de ambos paises.
					
					Destaco que en el futuro tambien, hara ingente esfuerzo junto con los companeros chinos por fortalecer y desarrollar mas la amistad Corea-China, que tiene larga historia, conforme al proposito de los maximos Dirigentes de las dos naciones.
					
					Deseo al ejercito y el pueblo de pais vecino que logren grandes exitos en la construccion socialista de tipo chino y en el fortalecimiento de las fuerzas armadas revolucionarias.
					
					Li Jinai, en su discurso, senalo que China y Corea son paises vecinos colindados por montanas y rios y las tradicionales relaciones de amistad se desarrollan de generacion en generacion.
					
					Enseno que la amistad entre ambas partes preparada por el Presidente Mao Zedong y el Presidente Kim Il Sung supero las pruebas del tiempo y manifiesta la gran vitalidad.
					
					Subrayo que es un placer que bajo la direccion del PTC encabezado por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il el ejercito y el pueblo de Corea logran mayores avances en el cumplimento de la causa de la construccion del Estado.
					
					Expreso la conviccion de que el ejercito y el pueblo de la heroica Corea lograran en el futuro mayores exitos.

articles.title: Delegacion militar china rinde homenaje a Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Periodicos revelan intento de ataque preventivo nuclear de EE.UU.
						

					Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- En un comentario individual difundido este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun revela el intento de ataque preventivo nuclear de Estados Unidos contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					La estrategia militar de EE.UU. sobre la RPDC es aplastarla con el ataque preventivo nuclear, comienza el comentario y continua.
					
					EE.UU. puso la RPDC en la lista de ataque preventivo nuclear y elaboro el documento de guerra que estipula usar las armas nucleares contra esta en el "tiempo de emergencia" junto con los titeres surcoreanos.
					
					En el territorio surcoreano se libran cada ano los ejercicios militares conjuntos conforme al guion de la guerra nuclear.
					
					Recientemente, EE.UU. desarrollo con Japon el simulacro militar conjunto en los alrededores de la Peninsula Coreana movilizando las enormes fuerzas armadas bajo el pretexto de enfrentarse a la "amenaza nuclear" de alguien.
					
					Esta claro que este entrenamiento es para atacar a la RPDC.
					
					Tal situacion demuestra que la ambicion de ataque preventivo nuclear de EE.UU. entro en la etapa imprudente.
					
					  El imperio debe abandonar tal anacronico e inutil intento de ataque preventivo nuclear a la RPDC, lo que es la via para salvarlo de la derrota.
					
					El periodico Minju Joson, en su comentario individual, subraya que los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos trazaron la "estrategia de disuasivo ampliado" de usar paraguas nucleares, el sistema antimisiles y otros equipos belicos sofisticados, lo cual es, de hecho, la estrategia de provocacion de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC so pretexto del "disuasivo".

articles.content:

articles.title: RPDC doblega a Japon en el partido de futbol
articles.content:
RPDC doblega a Japon en el partido de futbol 

					Pyongyang, 16 de noviembre (ACNC) -- La seleccion coreana vencio por 1 a 0 a su rival japones en un partido del grupo C de las clasificatorias asiaticas de tercera etapa para la Copa Mundial 2014 de la FIFA.
					
					Este juego tuvo lugar ayer en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung centrando gran atencion de los nacionales y extranjeros.
					
					El estadio estuvo repleto de los hinchas que redoblaron el animo de los jugadores coreanos con sus apasionados e incesantes coros y ovaciones.
					
					La competencia fue tan renida desde su inicio como pronosticaron los especialistas.
					
					El primer tiempo transcurrio con la ofensiva casi unilateral del once coreano.
					
					El primer chance de gol se dio a los 23 minutos de la primera mitad cuando cometio falta un jugador japones.
					
					Aprovechando el tiro libre a unos 17 metros desde el arco, un jugador coreano envio el balon en una curva elegante que fue cogido a duras penas por el portero japones.
					
					El equipo japones fallo en el primer tiempo en sus dos tiros a larga distancia.
					
					El gol decisivo fue anotado a los 4 minutos de la segunda mitad por Pak Nam Chol.
					
					En entrevista de prensa concedida despues de terminada la competencia, Zaccheroni Alberto (de 58 anos de edad), entrenador jefe del equipo japones, dijo que el equipo coreano es mas fuerte que el japones en la competitividad y tenacidad.
					
					Yun Jong Su (de 49 anos de edad), entrenador jefe de la seleccion coreana, destaco satisfecho que la victoria de sus discipulos se debe a la audacia y coraje que les fueron infundidos por el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
